No, this is not an April Fool’s Day joke. Governor Whitmer will be deciding the fate of schools tomorrow- Thursday, April 2. All indicators point to closing it down for the year. We will need to provide distance learning through electronic means, packets or a combination of both. We are meeting as a staff tomorrow via Zoom to discuss the best ways to deliver instruction while remaining reasonable for staff, students and families. Decisions will be shared with you when the processes are in place and our plans will begin the week of April 13. Emails have been sent to students to give them a heads up and a little more information… please discuss the content of those emails with your children. We have many decisions to make, but in the meanwhile enjoy your family, stay academically active, safe and healthy!

Ken Szczepanski, Principal

On February 25th, the Hopkins High School Concert and Chamber Choirs traveled to Marshall High School to participate in District Choral Festival. Each choir performed two contrasting pieces, as well as sight-read, for a panel of judges. Choir students then received feedback from those judges on numerous musical elements of their performances. That feedback highlighted both strengths, as well as areas of potential improvement, within each choir’s performances. As part of the process, choirs that perform that day are also given an overall rating/score. In addition to the positive educational experiences of that festival day, BOTH High School Choirs received an “Excellent—1st Division” rating and BOTH have qualified for State Choral Festival.

If choir students, as a group, choose to participate in State Choral Festival, that will take place at the beginning of May at Hope College. Congratulations to the students of the Hopkins Concert Choir and the Hopkins Chamber Choir for their fantastic performances and accomplishments at District Choral Festival this year!
